thread.title: Buford eyes are smiling; Wolves headed to Ireland in 2016
thread.title_full: Buford eyes are smiling; Wolves headed to Ireland in 2016

author: AccessWDUN Staff
title: Buford eyes are smiling; Wolves headed to Ireland in 2016
text:
Buford coach Jess Simpson reacts during a game. photo: David McGregor Related Articles 2015 High school football rankings 2015 High School Football region standings (VIDEO) Game of the Week : Banks, Dawson chase for history sets foes on collision course Week 9: Playoff chase hits critical mass for several area teams, regions (VIDEO) 
BUFORD — Buford football is going worldwide. 
The Wolves, along with three other Atlanta-area squads, will trek to Ireland next season to take part in the Aer Lingus College Football Classic on Sept. 2 in Dublin. The Classic's big feature is the Georgia Tech-Boston College contest. 
Buford's opponent -- which has not been set yet -- will be a non-Georgia squad. It will be counted as a regular-season game. The other two Atlanta-area high school teams making the trip are Marist and Blessed Trinity. 
Buford has played regular season contests in both Texas and Ohio in past seasons. Associated Categories : Local/State News , High School Sports , Sports , Friday Game Night Associated Tags : High school football, Buford football © Copyright 2015 AccessWDUN.com
